data.enText: a set of strips of leather and metal pieces that is put around a horse's head and body so that the horse can be controlled and fastened to a carriage , etc.
a set of strips of leather, etc. for fastening sth to a person's body or to keep them from moving off or falling
data.chText: （用于人，起固定或保护作用的）背带，保护带

data.enText: doing your normal work, especially after a rest or a holiday
data.chText: （尤指休息或假期结束后）做正常工作

data.enText: working closely with sb in order to achieve sth
to put a harness on a horse or other animal; to attach a horse or other animal to sth with a harness
data.chText: 给（马等）上挽具；用挽具把…套到…上

data.enText: We harnessed two ponies to the cart.
data.chText: 我们把两匹矮种马套到了车上。

data.enText: In some areas, the poor feel harnessed to their jobs.
data.chText: 有些地区的穷人感觉终身被套牢在他们的工作上。

data.enText: to control and use the force or strength of sth to produce power or to achieve sth
data.chText: 控制，利用（以产生能量等）

data.enText: attempts to harness the sun's rays as a source of energy
data.chText: 利用日光作为能源的尝试

data.enText: We must harness the skill and creativity of our workforce.
data.chText: 我们必须尽量发挥全体职工的技能和创造力。

simple_means.memory_skill: har- 军队 + -ness 性质,状态等

means: (用于人，起固定或保护作用的)背带，保护带
控制，利用(以产生能量等)

data.enText: doing your normal work, especially after a rest or a holiday
data.chText: （尤指休息或假期结束后）做正常工作

data.enText: working closely with sb in order to achieve sth

tr: stable gear consisting of an arrangement of leather straps fitted to a draft animal so that it can be attached to and pull a cart
a support consisting of an arrangement of straps for holding something to the body (especially one supporting a person suspended from a parachute)
control and direct with or as if by reins

example.ex: ...the movement's ability to harness the anger of all Ukrainians...
example.tran: 该运动之疏解所有乌克兰人怒气的能力

example.ex: Turkey plans to harness the waters of the Tigris and Euphrates rivers for big hydro-electric power projects.
example.tran: 土耳其计划利用底格里斯河和幼发拉底河的河水开发大型水电项目。

value.def: If you harness something such as an emotion or natural source of energy, you bring it under your control and use it.
A harness is a set of straps which fit under a person's arms and fasten round their body in order to keep a piece of equipment in place or to prevent the person moving from a place.
value.tran: （系在身上用以携带装备或限制其移动的）系带，背带

value.def: A harness is a set of leather straps and metal links fastened round a horse's head or body so that the horse can have a carriage, cart, or plough fastened to it.

example.ex: On Sunday the horses were harnessed to a heavy wagon for a daylong ride over the Border.
example.tran: 星期天，马匹被套在一辆沉重的马车上，准备踏上长达一天的穿越边境之旅。

value.def: If a horse or other animal is harnessed, a harness is put on it, especially so that it can pull a carriage, cart, or plough.

example.ex: At Opera North he will be in harness with Paul Daniel, the conductor appointed music director last year.
example.tran: 在北方歌剧公司，他将和去年指挥指定的音乐总监保罗·丹尼尔通力合作。

value.def: People or things who are working in harness are working together in order to achieve a particular aim.

example.ex: You can rest for three or four months and then the longing for work will return and you will be right back in harness.
example.tran: 你可以休息三四个月，然后又会开始渴望工作，并能很快回到正常的工作状态。

value.def: If you say that someone is in harness, you mean that they are working, often after a period of not working.
value.tran: （常指停止工作一段时间后）正常工作的

trans: 互相配合;通力合作；（常指停止工作一段时间后）正常工作的
线束；線束；电子线束；汽车线束；电线
套着马具死去；殉职；死于工作岗位

ill adj.生病的 + -ness 性质,状态等

good adj.合意的 + -ness 性质,状态等

wit n.颖悟力 + -ness 性质,状态等
sick adj.病的 + -ness 性质,状态等
